full_summary:
# Volunteer Coordinator Services for Vancouver Island

## Solicitation Number: 21882-23-0002/A

## Amendment Number: 6

## Closing Date and Time: October 23, 2023, 5:00 PM (Pacific Time)

## Description

The Correctional Service Canada (CSC) is seeking a Volunteer Coordinator to provide services for Vancouver Island. The successful contractor will be responsible for coordinating the Vancouver Island Community Corrections Volunteer Program, with a focus on the Community Adult Mentoring and Support (CAMS) Project.

## Key Responsibilities

* Coordinating the Vancouver Island Community Corrections Volunteer Program with a focus on CAMS Project
* Providing support to offenders with mental health problems
* Creating a group of trained volunteers to work with offenders in the community
* Developing and maintaining a schedule of offender activities originating from CSC and contracted agencies within the area
* Actively liaising with various agencies and organizations to establish and maintain projects aiming to strengthen community resources for conditionally released offenders

## Performance Requirements

* Ensure each volunteer completes their application and provides these applications to the Project Authority or delegate prior to processing them through the Programs department for Vancouver Island Community Corrections
* Ensure the security clearance for each potential volunteer is processed through NHQ or locally via CPIC clearance when only site access is needed to perform the volunteer activity
* Provide a quarterly report to the Area Director, Vancouver Island Community Corrections, outlining the last month's progress on each of the major areas of responsibilities

## Award Criteria

* The CSC will award the contract to the contractor submitting the lowest compliant bid

## Contract Duration and Value

* The contract is expected to commence on November 1, 2023, and end on March 31, 2025
* The estimated value of the contract is up to $1,700 hours per year

## Contact Information

* Contracting Authority: Katie Simpson
* Telephone: 604-870-2401
* Email: 801BidSubmissions@csc-scc.gc.ca

## Important Notes

* Documents may be submitted in either English or French
* After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process
* Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning about the federal government contracting process. The seminars are free. For more information, please visit the Buyandsell.gc.ca website.
